Package projetofinalpoo

Class MagazineArticle

java.lang.Object
projetofinalpoo.Publication
projetofinalpoo.MagazineArticle
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Publication>
public class MagazineArticle
extends Publication
A MagazineArticle is a child class of a Publication class so it inherits its methods and variables. A ConferenceArticle is represented by its name, its date of launch, its magazine number and all the variables that define a Publication.
See Also:
Publication, Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • MagazineArticle

      public MagazineArticle()
      Sole constructor

    • MagazineArticle

      public MagazineArticle​(java.lang.String title, java.util.List<Researcher> author, java.lang.String summary, java.util.List<java.lang.String> keywords, int publicationYear, int audience, java.lang.String name, Date date, int magazineNumber)
      Constructor that initializes the MagazineArticle and Publications values (title, author, summary, keywords, publicationYear, audience, name, date, magazineNumber)
      Parameters:
      title - name of the title
      author - List of Researcher objects that made this MagazineArticle
      summary - description of this MagazineArticle
      keywords - List of Strings that describe this MagazineArticle
      publicationYear - year that this MagazineArticle was published
      audience - quantity of people to which this MagazineArticle was shown to
      name - name of the magazine where this MagazineArticle was written
      date - date of launch of this MagazineArticle
      magazineNumber - number of the magazine where this MagazineArticle was written
      See Also:
      Publication

    • impactFactorCalculator

      public java.lang.String impactFactorCalculator()
      This method calculates the impact factor a book type publication has. A MagazineArticle has a impact factor "A" when its audience is more or equal than 1000, has a impact factor of "B" when its audience is less than 1000 but more or equal than 500 and has impact factor "C" when its audience is less than 500.
      Specified by:
      impactFactorCalculator in class Publication
      Returns:
      the impact factor of this MagazineArticle

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Method that describes the characteristics of a MagazineArticle. It returns a string in the following format:

      Title : __, Summary : __, Type : __

      Keywords : __

      Authors : __, Publication Year : __

      Magazine name : __, Magazine date : __, Magazine number : __

      Note: __ is the place where the values are going to appear (they change object to object)

      Overrides:
      toString in class Publication
      Returns:
      a String that describes a MagazineArticle object
